headline: Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY): $6.6B One-Off Loss Challenges Quality of Recent Earnings
summary: Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY) is facing a 6% annual revenue decline projected over the next three years. The company has turned profitable in the past five years, growing earnings by 10.8% per year. Earnings are expected to rise by a moderate 4.6% annually moving forward, although this pace lags the broader US market. Recent results were clouded by a one-off $6.6 billion loss that affected reported earnings quality for the twelve months to September 2025. See our full analysis for Bristol-Myers...
